meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a spoof.
meanings.sent1: The spoofy movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's spoofy performance was a hit.
meanings.sent3: The spoofy skit had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her spoofy sense of humor brightened the room.
meanings.sent5: The spoofy costume added a fun touch to the party.

meanings.sent1: The spoofy of the famous singer was hilarious.
meanings.sent2: We watched a spoofy of our favorite movie last night.
meanings.sent3: The spoofy of the president's speech was spot-on.
meanings.sent4: His spoofy of a superhero was incredibly creative.
meanings.sent5: The spoofy captured the essence of the original perfectly.

meanings.definition: To deceive or trick in a playful manner.
meanings.sent1: She tried to spoofy her friend by hiding behind the door.
meanings.sent2: He spoofyed his brother by pretending to be a ghost.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to spoofy their teacher with a fake spider.
meanings.sent4: The magician spoofyed the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The prankster spoofyed his classmates with a fake lottery ticket.
